text: hello this is Bill Cunningham in New
York and it's the first of August first
week in August and traditionally women
in New York are all changing to black
well you know you could never bet on
fashion suddenly everything's gray but
it started in the spring and I thought
curiosity there's always great flannel
or something but it's all gray and when
you think back to Dior's new look in
1947 the big success yes he had the bar
jacket but with the gray flannel suits
last week along came a woman that was
wearing no gray at all and she had drawn
on her t-shirt gray is the new black I
thought if she got the message she's not
wearing it but she got the message but
more than that it's a vast spectrum of
gray everything from platinum to deep
charcoal gray it's really the evolution
of fashion and color is totally
unpredictable that's what's so wonderful
about it
